intro: Lycianthes porteriana, commonly known as the yellow hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
